criteria: Demonstrates respectful communication and interaction with peers and adults.
Actively participates in creating a positive and inclusive environment.
Demonstrates responsibility and accountability for their actions.
descriptions: Consistently uses disrespectful or offensive language; engages in bullying or harassment.
Often uses disrespectful language or tone; occasionally participates in negative interactions.
Sometimes uses respectful language; occasionally demonstrates positive interactions, but inconsistencies are present.
Generally uses respectful language and tone; usually interacts positively with others; minor inconsistencies may be present.
Consistently uses respectful language and tone; actively listens and responds thoughtfully to others; promotes positive interactions.
Serves as a role model for respectful communication and interaction; consistently demonstrates empathy, kindness, and inclusivity; proactively addresses disrespectful behavior.
Actively contributes to a negative or exclusive environment; shows no effort to promote positivity.
Rarely participates in activities that promote a positive environment; shows little interest in inclusivity.
Sometimes participates in activities that promote a positive environment; demonstrates some awareness of inclusivity.
Regularly participates in activities that promote a positive environment; actively supports inclusivity and diversity.
Takes initiative in creating a positive and inclusive environment; actively promotes respect and understanding among peers.
Leads initiatives to promote a positive and inclusive environment; advocates for the needs of diverse groups; empowers others to create positive change.
Consistently avoids taking responsibility for their actions; blames others for their mistakes.
Rarely takes responsibility for their actions; makes excuses or minimizes their impact.
Sometimes takes responsibility for their actions; may need prompting or reminders.
Usually takes responsibility for their actions; acknowledges mistakes and attempts to make amends.
Consistently takes responsibility for their actions; reflects on their behavior and learns from their mistakes.

Serves as a role model for responsibility and accountability; proactively addresses their mistakes and takes steps to prevent future errors; supports others in taking responsibility for their actions.
